by Graham Williams

Section W CTAN Edition

Welcome to the XML based and XSL generated version of The TeX Catalogue Online, Section W CTAN Edition. This is a listing of entries in the TeX Catalogue and may take a little time to load, but is hopefully worth it. Have a look at the Catalogue Preface for alternative ways of accessing the catalogue.

The TeX Catalogue Online is also available from any CTAN node or mirror, including the following. Pick one that is close to you. (The "search" link attempts to find a CTAN node that may be close to you, courtesy of Randy Kobes. Multiple clicks may find alternatives.)



search

aarnet

switch

cstug

dante

loria

tex

roma

riken

gust

rge

ctan

Icons associated with many entries in the catalogue allow you to:

  • view the directory on CTAN
  • view documentation (possibly many)
  • view documentation in PDF format (requires the acroread plugin)
  • jump to the package's home page
  • download a gzip'd tar file from a nearby CTAN node (not supported by all nodes)
  • download a gzip'd tar file from ftp.dante.de

Other icons simply provide further information about the package:

  • part of the teTeX distribution
  • available on the TeX Live CD ROM

The license type, version (if known), and the date of the last change made to each particular Catalogue entry are also provided.

Use of these web documents and information contained herein is subject to the CSIRO Legal Notice and Disclaimer.

warpcol No caption.
Defines a tabular column type for formatting numerical columns in LaTeX. The column type enables numerical items to be right justified relative to each other, while centred beneath the column label. In addition, macros are provided to enable variations on this column type to be defined. Usage of the package is superficially similar to that of dcolumn ; however, the alignment scheme is different, and the packages have different, though overlapping, applications.
license: unknown (1998/09/13)
wasy The wasy fonts (Waldis symbol fonts).
The wasy fonts (Waldis symbol fonts). See also wasy2 wasy-ps
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
wasy2 The wasy fonts (Waldis symbol fonts).
The wasy fonts (Waldis symbol fonts). See also wasy2-ps
license: unknown (1998/07/25)
wasy2-ps No caption.
Converted (PostScript) outlines of the wasy fonts.
license: unknown (1998/08/5)
wasy-ps No caption.
Converted (PostScript) outlines of the wasy fonts. See also wasy2-ps
license: unknown (1998/07/25)
wasysym Extra characters from the Waldis symbol fonts.
Makes some additional characters available that come from the wasy fonts (Waldis symbol fonts). These fonts are not automatically included in NFSS2/LaTeX2e since they take up important space and often aren't necessary if one makes use of the packages amsfonts or amssymb. Symbols include: join box, diamond, leadsto, sqsubset, lhd, rhd, apple, ocircle invneg, logof, varint, male, female, phone, clock lightning, pointer, sun, bell, permil, smiley, various electrical symbols, shapes, music notes, circles, signs, astronomy, etc.
license: lppl (1999/05/19)
web2c The ``standard'' source C version of the TeX sysmtem.
Uses the GNU autconfig package to compile and install effortlessly. Simply ./configure; make; make install. See also amiweb2c web2c-win32
license: gpl version: 7.2 (1999/03/03)
web2c-win32 No caption.
Web2c for MS-Windows32, including a complete collection of TeX related executables. See also web2c
license: gpl version: 7.2 (1999/03/03)
williams Miscellaneous macros by Peter Williams.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
win95-guide No caption.
An installation-guide for a complete TeX-System consisting of MiKTeX , WinEdt and GhostView.
license: unknown (1998/04/12)
windvi No description available.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
winedt MS-Windows95 shell and editor for TeX.
A full-featured text editor and Shell for MS-Windows95 (and MS-Windows NT or MS-Windows 3.x), allowing the editting of large, multiple, text files in the usual MS-Windows95 way, using a Multiple Documents Interface (MDI) and following or extending the MS-Windows' Standards in every respect, and supporting (LaTeX) Syntax Highlighting and Input/Output ASCII Code Translation Tables with a comprehensive context-sensitive Help. See also ntemacs miktex win95-guide texshell32 winshell fourtex
license: nondfsg (1998/07/2)
winemtex No caption.
A full emTeX distribution for MS-Windows98 including GhostScript and WinEdit and preconfigured to work with TeX.
license: unknown (1998/08/3)
winshell A MS-Windows32 user interface for TeX.
It is not a TeX-system---you need an additional TeX package for DOS/MS-Windows (e.g., miktex and web2c-win32 ). For previewing documents you will need something like GhostScript or dviwin. See also texshell32 winedt fourtex
license: nocommercial version: 2.0beta (1999/04/09)
wmf2eps No caption.
A program to simplify MS-Windows Metafile Graphics (WMF) containing either vector-images or bitmaps into Encapsulated PostScript format having tight bounding-boxes (WinNT and Win95) at exactly the same size as the WMF-originals.
license: unknown version: 1.1 (1998/11/12)
wnri No caption.
MetaFont fonts for Old English, Indic languages in transcription, and American Indian languages.
license: unknown (1998/06/30)
wntamil No caption.
Fonts (MetaFont) and support for Tamil, created at the University of Washington.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
word2x No caption.
A word 6 to anything converter, currently supporting output formats in text and LaTeX. See also catdoc
license: gpl (1997/04/29)
wp2latex Convert WordPerfect documents to LaTeX.
See also wp-conv texperf
license: gpl version: 2.62 (1999/04/13)
wp-conv No caption.
A list (in HTML format) of packages for converting between LaTeX and TeX documents and a variety of other formats including RTF, Word, and Wordperfect. See also texperf wp2latex catdoc
license: unknown (1998/08/1)
wrapfig Produces figures which text can flow around.
Does not work in combination with list environments, but can be used in a parbox or minipage, and in twocolumn format.
license: dfsg (1 Apr 1991)
wsuipa Style for using International Phonetic Alphabet fonts.
license: unknown (1998/08/13)
wtex95 No caption.
A flexible, 32-bit MS-Windows-TeX-editor with Highlight-O-Matic syntax-highlighting.
license: unknown version: 2.01 (1998/02/24)
